description: Configure your Lambda functions to stream response payloads back to clients. For more information, see Configuring a Lambda function to stream responses. This operation requires permission for the lambda:InvokeFunction action. For details on how to set up permissions for cross-account invocations, see Granting function access to other accounts.

parameters.name: FunctionName
parameters.description: The name or ARN of the Lambda function. Function name --- my-function. Function ARN --- arn:aws:lambda:us-west-2:123456789012:function:my-function. Partial ARN --- 123456789012:function:my-function. The length constraint applies only to the full ARN. If you specify only the function name, it is limited to 64 characters in length.

parameters.name: InvocationType
parameters.description: Use one of the following options: RequestResponse (default) --- Invoke the function synchronously. Keep the connection open until the function returns a response or times out. The API operation response includes the function response and additional data. DryRun --- Validate parameter values and verify that the IAM user or role has permission to invoke the function.

parameters.name: Payload
parameters.description: The JSON that you want to provide to your Lambda function as input. You can enter the JSON directly. For example, --payload '{ "key": "value" }'. You can also specify a file path. For example, --payload file://payload.json.

nested_items.name: StatusCode
nested_items.description: For a successful request, the HTTP status code is in the 200 range. For the RequestResponse invocation type, this status code is 200. For the DryRun invocation type, this status code is 204.

nested_items.name: ExecutedVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the function that executed. When you invoke a function with an alias, this indicates which version the alias resolved to.

nested_items.name: PayloadChunk
nested_items.description: A chunk of the streamed response payload.

nested_items.name: Payload
nested_items.description: Data returned by your Lambda function.

nested_items.name: InvokeComplete
nested_items.description: An object that's returned when the stream has ended and all the payload chunks have been returned.

nested_items.name: ErrorDetails
nested_items.description: The details of any returned error.

nested_items.name: LogResult
nested_items.description: The last 4 KB of the execution log, which is base64-encoded.

nested_items.name: ResponseStreamContentType
nested_items.description: The type of data the stream is returning.
